text: Gheorghe Guşet (28 May 1968 – 12 June 2017) was a Romanian shot putter.Gheorghe Gușet. IAAF He competed at the 1992, 2000 and 2004 Olympics and had his best result in 2004, aged 36 (14th place). Guşet was noted for being competitive in his late 30s, and set his all-time personal record aged 38, while most shot putters peak in their late 20s or early 30s. Due to health problems (chronic kidney disease) he was forced to retire from competitions in 2008.Gheorghe Gușet . sports-reference.com Guşet died on 12 June 2017 in Cluj Napoca, Romania from an aortic dissection at the age of 49.Mesajul lui Sandu Lungu, după moartea prietenului și colegului Gheorghe Gușet. “Ești o legendă; erai un idol pentru mine” ==References== Category:1968 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from aortic dissection Category:Olympians for Romania Category:Shot putters Category:Sălaj County
title: Gheorghe Gușet
